text:
Heartbroken for the Pittsburgh Jewish community, the first faith community that ever made me feel like I really belonged. 

Heartbroken for this predominantly black church and the families/community who lost loved ones to racist violence. 

These evils are connected.

text: C-SPAN is taking callers on the #KavanaughHearings. First two callers, one independent and one Republican, both men, insist Blasey Ford is lying. The third, a Democrat, is crying and saying she was molested in second grade, and this has brought it all up again.

text: Jane Fonda had a big movie out this year. Her Netflix show, @GraceandFrankie, is entering its 5th season. She is busy campaigning across the country for farmworkers, and domestic workers, and restaurant workers. And SHE IS 80. She was made for this moment:
author: marincogan

text: She went from Barbarella to getting arrested for her activism so quickly. She made mistakes, which she was very candid about. She spoke to me about the importance of thinking really carefully about what you want your life to be, and then going for it. https://www.thecut.com/2018/09/jane-fonda-profile-hbo-documentary.html …
author: marincogan

text: In the movie, and in my piece, she touches on so many things: growing up with a difficult father, losing her mother, struggling with an eating disorder, and deciding, in her early 30s as a young mother, to radically transform her life by becoming an activist.
author: marincogan

text: .@HBO will release a documentary on Fonda's life, called Jane Fonda in Five Acts, on Sept 24th. I *highly* recommend you watch it. Very few people have lived such great, big, public and controversial lives.
author: marincogan

text: I had the absolute pleasure of interviewing Jane Fonda for this month's issue of @NYMag & @TheCut. There was laughter, and tears, and so much insight about aging, forgiveness, and the importance of *putting in the work*--which she's still doing, at 80!
author: marincogan

text: They’re lucky to have you!
author: marincogan

text: I love Pittsburgh, and watching the decline of its local newspapers has been beyond distressing. The people who live there deserve great coverage of their communities--and the good journalists who work there deserve to be able to do their jobs.
author: marincogan
